title: Commit Message Validation Strategy
description: Schema for commit message validation strategy definitions

name.description: Strategy identifier (lowercase, hyphens allowed). Used as the 'strategy' input value.

version.description: Semantic version of this strategy definition

description.description: Human-readable description of what this strategy validates

author.description: Author or organization that defined this strategy

type.description: Validation scope: 'first-line' validates only the commit subject line, 'full-message' validates the entire commit message structure

oneOf.description: First-line validation (one regex pattern for the commit subject line only)

flags.description: Regex flags: g=global, i=case-insensitive, m=multiline, s=dotall, u=unicode, v=unicodeSets, y=sticky

message.description: Short error message shown when validation fails

oneOf.description: Full-message validation (multiple field patterns for structured commit messages)

mode.description: all: all fields must match (AND logic) | any: at least one field must match (OR logic)

pattern.description: JavaScript regex pattern for this field

flags.description: Regex flags for this field's pattern

message.description: Error message shown when this field fails validation

description.description: Detailed explanation of what this field validates

errorFormat.description: Template for error messages shown when validation fails.

skip.description: Optional configuration for skipping commits (e.g., merge commits)

enabled.description: Whether to skip commits matching the pattern

pattern.description: Regex pattern to match commits that should be skipped (tests against first line)

message.description: Log message prefix when skipping (commit SHA will be appended automatically)

metadata.description: Optional metadata for documentation and enhanced error messages

invalid.description: Examples of invalid commit messages with explanations

documentation.description: URL to full documentation for this commit format
